business.headline: Explained: Why Ola Electric shares jumped over 6% todayOla Electric shares rebound sharply after a month-long slump. Read on to know what fuelled today's surge.

PN Gadgil Jewellers makes bumper debut: Book profit now or stay invested?PN Gadgil Jewellers share price: Market experts see the sharp premium at listing as a signal of investor confidence in PN Gadgil's strong growth trajectory.

PN Gadgil Jewellers shares make bumper debut with 73% premium over IPO pricePN Gadgil Jewellers listing: The Maharashtra-based jewellery retail chain saw a strong listing on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), where its shares opened at Rs 834, marking a 73.75% premium.
Sensex, Nifty open flat near all-time highs ahead of US Fed's rate decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 23.7 points at 82,965.08, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 3.25% to 25,380.50.

Amazon, Flipkart violated competition laws by favouring certain sellers: ReportThe investigation was triggered by a complaint from the Delhi Vyapar Mahasangh, which is an affiliate of the country's biggest trade body, Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT), that represents 80 million retailers.

US Fed poised to cut rates: Can it steer economy toward soft landing?After months of elevated interest rates, the Fed is likely to lower its benchmark rate, potentially giving a much-needed break to the economy.

Sensex, Nifty close slightly higher; Bajaj Housing Finance shines on debutThe S&P BSE Sensex ended the trading session 97.84 points higher at 82,988.78, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 27.25 points to settle at 25,383.75.

Sebi withdraws statement blaming external elements for staff protestsJust under two weeks ago, Sebi had issued a statement suggesting that external forces were behind the unrest among its staff, which was seen as an attempt to discredit the organisation and its leadership.

Missed Bajaj Housing Finance listing day rally? Check these alternate optionsBajaj Housing Finance bumper listing: By the end of the trading session, the company's stock price stood at Rs 164.99, marking a significant increase over its IPO issue price. But for those who missed out on the listing day windfall, what are the next steps?

Oberoi inheritance war: Siblings clash over late PRS Oberoi's willOn one side are Vikramjit Oberoi, Natasha Oberoi, and Arjun Oberoi. On the other side is Anastasia Oberoi, PRS Oberoi's daughter from his second marriage to Mirjana Jojic Oberoi.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares hit upper circuit after bumper listing: What's next?Bajaj Housing Finance listing: By midday, the shares hit an upper circuit at Rs 164.99, representing an overall premium of 135.70% over the IPO price.

'Can afford, but won't buy': Edelweiss MF CEO on not owning luxury carsEdelweiss MF Radhika Gupta CEO currently owns an Innova, which is known for its practicality and reliability rather than for being a luxury car.

From branch manager to CEO: How Atul Jain transformed Bajaj Housing FinanceAtul Jain, now 52, has been with the Bajaj Group for over two decades. He began his career in investment banking, working as a project executive at PNB Capital Services Limited and later at Prudential Capital Markets Limited.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares list at 114% premium. What should investors do? With Bajaj Housing Finance shares debuting at a staggering 114% premium, investors face a pivotal choice: lock in profits now or stay the course for potential long-term rewards. Find out what experts suggest for your next move.
Kross shares list flat on D-Street: Should you book profit or hold? Kross listing: Shares of Kross made a flat debut opening at Rs 240 on NSE and BSE, the same as its IPO price.

Bajaj Housing Finance turns multibagger on listing: Book profits or hold?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: With this blockbuster entry on Dalal Street, the key dilemma for investors is now whether to book profits immediately or hold onto their positions for long-term gains.
Sensex, Nifty rally as Fed rate cut looms; markets stay bullishThe S&P BSE Sensex added 169.53 points to 83,060.47, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 62.55 points to 25,419.05

Bajaj Housing Finance makes bumper debut as shares list at 114% premiumBajaj Housing Finance listing: The shares were allocated to successful bidders on September 13, and the listing gains of Rs 80 per share slightly exceeded the grey market premium (GMP).

Gold, silver price today, September 16, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today September 16, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Atishi to be next Delhi Chief Minister, Arvind Kejriwal proposes name Live UpdatesAtishi's name was proposed by Kejriwal at the meeting of the legislature party, and it was unanimously accepted by the AAP MLAs.

Why Atishi was AAP's obvious choice to succeed Arvind Kejriwal as Chief MinisterNames of several AAP leaders were doing the rounds for the post of Chief Minister. Atishi, however, was the frontrunner for the top job as she had assumed a central role in the party after the arrest of Arvind Kejriwal.

Nagaland civilian killings: Top court cancels criminal case against Army personnelOn December 4, 2021, an Army team allegedly fired at a truck carrying miners in Oting village in Nagaland, mistaking them for militants.

Amit Shah on 100 days of Modi 3.0: Security improved, 11 lakh Lakhpati DidisMarking the NDA government's 100 days in office on Tuesday, Shah highlighted the government's efforts in strengthening internal security over the last decade, crediting the people for entrusting the BJP with another opportunity to lead the nation.

How Kejriwal outfoxed BJP, each time, every timeArvind Kejriwal outfoxed the BJP by announcing he would resign as Delhi's Chief Minister. With this, he has blunted the BJP's poll arrows, including the opportunity for him to be attacked as a 'CM out on bail'. Here's how Kejriwal has been shocking the BJP time and again.

Mamata Banerjee agrees to doctors' demands, announces removal of Kolkata top copMamata Banerjee announced the removal of Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Goyal and the Deputy Commissioner (North), who faced bribery allegations from the family of the trainee doctor who was raped and killed in Kolkata.

Army officer, partner claim custodial assault, harassment by Odisha PoliceAn Army officer and his partner have alleged that the Odisha Police subjected them to custodial assault and mistreatment while they approached them with a complaint over an attack on them by miscreants in Bhubaneswar.

CBI responded to all queries in Kolkata rape-murder status report: Supreme CourtKolkata rape-murder: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) submitted a fresh status report to the Supreme Court regarding the ongoing investigation into the RG Kar rape and murder case.

Geomagnetic storm hits Earth. Scientists caught off guardA Geomagnetic Storm happens when a CME or a high-speed solar wind stream interacts with the Earth's magnetosphere, causing a temporary disturbance in the magnetic field.

Woman jumps off 5th floor of residential building in Hyderabad, diesA 23-year-old Hyderabad woman jumped from the fifth floor of the building and ended her life. The incident has been captured by one of the onlookers.

Video: Bodycam footage shows dramatic arrest of Trump assassination bid suspectThe footage shows the gunman, Ryan Routh, walking backwards with his hands over his head before being handcuffed by US police officers.

Bengaluru woman slams BigBasket for sending free flowers on Onam. Internet reactsA Bengaluru woman slammed BigBasket for sending her free marigold flowers during the festival of Onam, questioning why the company was promoting the celebration.

Hindus targeted whenever there is instability in Bangladesh: Indian-origin MPTo raise awareness, Canadian MP Chandra Arya stated that they are planning a rally in front of the Canadian Parliament on September 23, which will also see participation from families of Canadian Buddhists and Christians with ties to Bangladesh.

Despite their impressive show so far, India are overwhelming favourites to win the title on Tuesday. Will home advantage spur China on in Hulunbuir?

Rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs arrested amid sex trafficking allegations American rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs has been arrested. This comes in the wake of numerous allegations of sexual abuse and trafficking against the musician.

Diljit Dosanjh reacts to Delhi Police's warning on fraudulent concert ticketsDiljit Dosanjh reacted to the Delhi Police's warning about fraudulent ticket sale links ahead of his concert in the national capital. Diljit will perform in India as a part of his Dil-Luminati Tour.

Trump, JD Vance blame Kamala Harris's 'rhetoric' for assassination bidFollowing the second assassination attempt on his life, Trump highlighted that the suspect, 58-years-old Ryan Wesley Routh, echoed Biden and Harris's language, suggesting that he is a threat to American democracy if he wins the upcoming November elections and retakes the White House.

Meta bans Russian state media outlets over 'foreign interference activity'The ban comes after the US filed money-laundering charges earlier this month against two employees of the Russian media outlet 'RT', for what officials said was a scheme to hire an American company to produce online content to influence the 2024 election.

Old CCTV clip of cop removing uniform after argument with BJP leader sparks rowSingrauli Superintendent of Police Nivedita Gupta said that the video was over eight months old and strict action was taken against the personnel, Vinod Mishra, for disrespecting the uniform.

You grow older rapidly at ages 44 and 60. Can you prepare for it?If you thought you would age gradually, you might be wrong. A new study has revealed that humans experience two periods of rapid ageing, once in mid-40s and again in early 60s.

Tamil Nadu toll booth sees protest over rate hike, traffic affected for hoursA massive protest led by MLA Abdul Samad against toll fee hikes and expired toll booth licences at Thuvakkudi in Tiruchirapalli caused significant traffic disruption.

Ex-British TV presenter given suspended sentence for indecent child imagesHuw Edwards pleaded guilty in July to three charges of making indecent images of children, relating to 41 illegal images he was sent via WhatsApp. His lawyer said that he didn't use the images for any "personal gratification".

Fukrey stars reunite at Pulkit Samrat-Kriti wedding, Richa Chada shares photosIt has been six months since actors Pulkit Samrat and Kriti Kharbanda got married. On the occasion, actor Richa Chadha shared some priceless photos from their Haldi ceremony. She also shared that she was six months pregnant then.

Kangana Ranaut calls censor board a 'redundant body', demands OTT censorshipActor and politician Kangana Ranaut underscored the importance of having censorship on OTT platforms. She talked about children enjoying the full control of such content online.

KBC 16: Big B couldn't understand Interstellar, says grandchildren poke fun at KalkiIn the latest episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati 16, Amitabh Bachchan shared that he struggles to understand Hollywood sci-fi films. He also revealed that his grandchildren often tease him about Kalki 2898 AD.

Stree 2 beats Animal at domestic box office in 33 days, now only behind JawanStree 2 is now the second highest-grossing Bollywood film of all time at the domestic box office. The horror-comedy is only behind Jawan to become the biggest Bollywood entertainer in the history of Hindi cinema.

Sangram Singh: Proving age is just a number ahead of venture into MMAIn an exclusive interaction with IndiaToday.in, Indian wrestler Sangram Singh talks about his main motivation to make the switch to MMA ahead of his first fight on September 21. Sangram will fight Ali Raza Nasir of Pakistan at the Gama International Fighting Championship.

Double 1960 Olympic champion Otis Davis dies at 92Otis Davis, a two-time Olympic gold medallist and a trailblazer in American track and field, died at the age of 92. Davis made history at the 1960 Rome Olympics, breaking barriers on and off the track.

Luke Shaw set to miss Manchester United's League Cup game vs BarnsleyManchester United are set to miss left back Luke Shaw in their League Cup game against Barnsley. Manager Erik Ten Hag was not able to give a timeline for the player's return.

Glasgow set to be announced as host city for 2026 Common Wealth Games: ReportThe Scottish capital of Glasgow is set to be announced as the host city of a "scaled down" Commonwealth Games in 2026, a year after Australian state Victoria pulled out due to ballooning costs, reported PTI on Monday, September 16.

Sakshee Malikkh, Geeta Phogat announce Wrestling Champions Super LeagueWrestlers Sakshee Malikkh and Geeta Phogat have announced that they are planning to launch Wrestling Champions Super League to help budding wrestlers in India. Phogat said that she and Sakshee had been planning for this for a long time.

Team India start intense training before Chepauk TestIND vs BAN: Rohit Sharma's India have started training hard before their opening Test against Bangladesh gets underway on Thursday, September 19 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.

India vs Bangladesh: R Ashwin looks to continue love affair with ChepaukStar India off spinner Ravichandran Ashwin will return to his home ground at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai as India restart their home Test season with the Bangladesh series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
